website_summaries.verdict: The best budget boat model kit that takes the need for painting the surface plastic parts out of the building process.
pros: Comes with a detailed deck full of accurate elevating guns and movable turrets
Smaller parts are easy to work with
Can save extra money without the need for paint
cons: The included decal stickers may start to peal off after a while and may require extra glue

customer_reviews.title: Great model for beginners looking for a battleship!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old decided he would ask Santa for a model battleship to build for Christmas which was odd and I really read reviews looking for a simple one and this seemed to be as easy as I was going to find. I figured it would be a project for him to do with his grandfather, to my surprise, he did most of it himself. It came out great, like some previous reviews a read when I got it, some of the bigger pieces are a little warped but we made it work. Overall it was great!
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: An old model with faults but great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is a venerable old model. I bought it for my son to build and demonstrate the excellent design of the hull. The hull made the Iowa so amazing is clearly not represented on this model. It is not the correct shape not even close. Should be labelled as a semi waterline . But it’s from 1954 Taking that into account it’s great. He still used it to show the ship slicing through the water.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: is it worth it?
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this.it took him 3 to 4 hours. 20 to 30 of the pieces were small guns. over all very impressed by the length it was at least 16 to17 inches. I would recommend ages from 8 years old. there was 1 challenging part to put the base on to the ship. this package actually came 4 days faster than planned.If this is your first model i really recommend this. over all great quality.
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Good, and easy to understand. But not perfect
customer_reviews.text: My first ever model ship, I would definitely continue building these. I will be honest that my paint job wasn’t the best, I did do it all under 5 hours with paint included. (And yes, I didn’t paint everything the exact way I was supposed to)
customer_reviews.author: Victor Detchev

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and built Revell model planes and boats when I was younger, so I thought this would be a quality product. So much for assuming! The instructions were very poor, the numbering system and location of parts was illegible and the quality of the individual parts was very very poor.. Whatever machines are used to cut and trim the parts is not doing a good job at all. If you want a model of the Missouri get it somewhere else... This one is not worth 5 cents.
customer_reviews.author: Norman T

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and difficult to identify parts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit to put together with my 7 year old grandson, who is pretty adept at model construction. Many of the pieces were so small that neither of us could hold them well enough to maneuver into place. Some of the pieces either bent or broke. The pieces were supposedly numbered, but the numbers on them were either non-existent or too small to read. I would not recommend this kit to anyone of any age.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter model...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad model but was disappointed in the lack of detail.
customer_reviews.author: Mosol

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build
customer_reviews.text: Missing some parts to the upper con tower. Bummer to get that far and be missing something important.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: Great battleship to build and great customer service to match
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product awhile ago and never left a review for it. Anyways, I love this battleship. It was super fun to build! My box actually had a problem though, it was missing a piece. Although I can say that it was probably a manufacturing issue, MMD Holdings was kind enough to send me a replacement! Now that is great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: John Wu

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a project
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as part of a school project for my eighth grade daughter who has never put together models like this before. It was a very easy kit for her, she spend a couple hours getting everything glued just right. The painting took the longest, but that was just because she let each color dry before she started another. She's a very OCD child, but this didn't take long and she didn't have any frustration while doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like pictures. Misrepresented. I feel extremely ripped off as does my son who saved up to buy this
customer_reviews.author: ani

customer_reviews.title: Three stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice model,but the navy planes on the catapults are very small and hard to build. Also, the hull is neither full nor waterline. There is a rudder but no propellers. Yet aside from that, it is a nice easy model I would recommend for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Parker

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! Easy to follow instructions and looks great ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! Easy to follow instructions and looks great when finished. Perfect for someone wanting to try more painting with fewer tiny pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Merrill

customer_reviews.title: good model
customer_reviews.text: nice build and looks good in my collection. thank you for your good and quick service.... Richard
customer_reviews.author: Richard Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loved putting this together. It is an excellent model and is now displayed in his room.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as many pieces as more detailed versions and nice size.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: plastic ship model Uss Missouri
customer_reviews.text: As a retired person I wanted a way to keep me busy. I find the assemble of these type models to be the way to do this. This battleship was fun to assemble and is great to look at after assembly. Revell creates great models of this type and I will continue to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: david l thrower

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Its was what i expected ist an awesome kit for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Ir was lacking detail and just didnt look great. But will order another model by a different ...
customer_reviews.text: Not really. Ir was lacking detail and just didnt look great. But will order another model by a different manfacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Corvarious

customer_reviews.title: The size it's too small
customer_reviews.text: It says that this ship is measured in in but it's not it's way smaller than what they tell you.
customer_reviews.author: silvia

customer_reviews.title: i recently purchased this product. i thought i would ...
customer_reviews.text: i recently purchased this product. i thought i would not have to paint it because it says "molded in COLOR". don't let that fool you, its not. i am biulding it anyway, but i have to buy paint first date of text: may 8, 2015 Jonathan.R.D
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: broken parts revell won't replace.
customer_reviews.text: This model had 4 broken parts, and revell won't replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy509

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with glue or the colors needed to paint it
customer_reviews.author: jenefer3

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: it' was to ease to put together , and a little bit small .
customer_reviews.author: FLEET ADMIRAL ***** WATSON . .

customer_reviews.title: Good model for intermediate skill builders
customer_reviews.text: Detailing is good - assembly and finishing instructions are clear.
customer_reviews.author: GSR

customer_reviews.title: ... (when Revell's factory was in Venice California) will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: This 50 year old kit (when Revell's factory was in Venice California) will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Kheng Yeoh

customer_reviews.title: Nine year old working on as first model, no problem.
customer_reviews.text: Nine year old working on as first model, no problem. Get it with the Arizona and you have the bookends of the naval war.
customer_reviews.author: CKC

customer_reviews.title: Exicting for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 8 years kid enjoyed working on this model. Few parts are tiny but manageable
customer_reviews.author: Anand P

customer_reviews.title: An old kit, and it shows.
customer_reviews.text: This was Revell's first plastic ship model first issued in the early 1950s. It has remained a popular seller since, being issued at various times as all four of the Iowa Class battleships. Detail is sparse, even in this large scale. No propellers at all, and the single large rudder is incorrect. The Curtiss Seahawk aircraft are badly sculpted. Okay as a ship kit for newer young modelers. I first built it some 50 years ago as a kid. Nothing has changed, except the historical data sheet added for the USS Missouri. It is a good stepping stone for young modelers, on their way to buildong better models.
customer_reviews.author: NRevellTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Good But Needed Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Revell USS Missouri a little over than two months ago, and I just finished building it, which took me like six days. Basically, all the parts are very small, so you have to be very careful not to break the delicate plastics. The ship model length is approximately twenty inches long, and the detail of the kit is extremely basic; thus if you want further details I would recommend to buy the 1/350 scale from other manufacturers such as Taniya. I hope in the future Revell will develop a bigger model kit of this historical battleship as the Trumpeter has recently released a 1/200 USS Missouri. When I have the budget, I'll definitely purchase the 1/200 one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Model for a Mid Level Person
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband who is totally loving this one! Good instructions and easy to match paint. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K

customer_reviews.title: Patience is a virtue
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is one of those things I just cannot grow out of doing. I love assembling these models. I like them in the unpainted formats - I dont like to paint them - thats me. The quality is reasonably ok - thats cause mine came with a slight warp. If it was any other part of the ship it would have been easy to straighten unfortunately the main body itself was warped. Eventually I put it together - but I wish the vendor would check the products prior to despatching. Btw in case ur wondering why I gave a 4 star rating for educational value - its just because it take a load of patience/dedication to complete.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Kandela

customer_reviews.title: Excellant
customer_reviews.text: This was a Secret Santa gift so I don't know how it was received but I"m sure it was fine...he had requested a battleship and my husband, being a Navy vet of WW two and the Korean War suggested the big Mo. It was nice to know a boy of 11 was interested in that era.
customer_reviews.author: Anne H Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have not finished assembling it, but looks like a quality model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great father/son project! completed in 1 week and ready for paint!
customer_reviews.author: history seeker

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.text: Ship very good quality. Does not take long to build. It is 19 inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good model
customer_reviews.text: Item received quickly great model for starters had a lot of fun building it since my grandpa served on this ship during Korea
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Chidester

customer_reviews.title: Too Small and Out of Scale
customer_reviews.text: It a shame model makers like Revell can't make their models in a consistent scale. Iowa class battleships are 1:535, Bismarck is 1:432, and Yamato is 1:716 or whatever. That said, the model is fairly accurate, but I was slightly disappointed by the lack of detail. It was cheap however, so no big loss.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: questionable quality.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm spoiled by Tamiya but the quality of this kit really is pretty bad. There were lots of flash, overflowing plastic from the molds. I returned it right away after opening it and seeing the sad state of these parts. Why sink hours of your time on something that will not look good later? Maybe for the money and for people who don't care about quality this is ok.
customer_reviews.author: K. Zhu

customer_reviews.title: It is not bad, but many better Missouri kits are available
customer_reviews.text: This model is older than most of our children ... or their children's children. It is not bad, but many better Missouri kits are available. (The better kits, Tamiya and Trumpeter are much more expensive.) Buy it for the nostalgia value as well as a fun project requiring not too much skill. A good paint job makes this a pretty decent display model.
customer_reviews.author: One Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kit, nice painting instructions
customer_reviews.text: Very nice kit,nice painting instructions. Overall another Revell great model
customer_reviews.author: biscuit magoo

customer_reviews.title: battleship model
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model for my 11 year old grandson. He had fun building it. Not too difficult. It is an accurate replica.
customer_reviews.author: clf

customer_reviews.title: excelente product
customer_reviews.text: all expectations, very good quality. recommended for any modeller amateur . . . . . . . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Itssss. Grrrrrreat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replica of the Mighty Mo (uss Missouri). I have seen and been on the ship before and I think this is a very good replica of the Mighty Mo. Its pretty good for beginners as long as you enjoy painting.The paint you need is black, wood tan, red,and silver.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: my son received this as a gift. He is 15, almost 16. Great to occupy his time. We are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linette Blaker

customer_reviews.title: Too Easy
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasently surprised by the mo model. i wasnt expecting it to be so big and it took me about a couple of hours to finish glueing together. i thought it was a skill level 3 with the propellers and the propeller shafts so that was another surprise but its a good model to get my feet wet again as i had not done a model in over a year due to homelessness.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Crump

customer_reviews.title: I was a little disappointed in the molding and fit of some parts
customer_reviews.text: This model was a bonding experience with my grandson. He was thrilled with it. I was a little disappointed in the molding and fit of some parts, particularly the smaller pieces. For the price, I expected better. Over all, it was a worthwhile experience.
customer_reviews.author: msmith

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: i liked the boat it was fun to build but i was hoping the paint came with it so that the bottom could be painted that red color
customer_reviews.author: Deadpool

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the parts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model hoping that the quality would be as good as some Japanese models, but alas! It is not. A lot of the parts were broken,the plastic was barely molded,some parts did not click together,and I was missing a lot of parts. Maybe I just had a bad kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Few details, very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst model kit I ever purchased. The mould looked like it's from 1953. The hull and deck pieces don't fit well. The hull is in one pieces and has no details. Do NOT purchase this kit if you're an intermediate or advanced modeler.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Revel has slipped..
customer_reviews.text: The whole lower half of the hull was missing. Much different than was shown on the box. No where near the detail I was expecting . Revell has really slipped since I was a kid: probably since all the kids now only want to play video games.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Magee

customer_reviews.title: I personally think its cheap but my 8 year old likes it
customer_reviews.text: The entire ship is made of cheap plastic and you have to twist small parts for assembly off of a large plastic piece The only cool part of the ship is that it comes with information about the USS Missouri My 8 year old assembled it quickly by himself so I can't comment on the instructions or the difficulty because I had nothing to do with assembly. I wouldn't purchase this product again but model kits are not my cup of tea .
customer_reviews.author: AJSmith

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: i didnt know it was a glue together, and the parts dont look real
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: purchased for 11 year old son
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this for his collection. He really likes it and it was a great value compared to models in the regular department store.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shreve

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is very poor quality. Just about every single part needs trimming. Also to many items on the deck made it hard to get a nice wood paint job. Items are too small to mask off. Bigger items do not line up correctly. Assembled most of it with super glue so parts would not shift during dry time. Sorry I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Hippygeorge

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Horrid product, bad part labeling of numbers on the model, just a waste of money. very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap no directions
customer_reviews.text: It was cheap and came with no directions for assembly lots of tiny pieces i would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Revel 1:535 Uss Missouri Battleship
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in the ad did it say this was a 'KIT'. It shows the model ship and that's what I expected shipped to my brother. Instead it is a package of many, many small parts which he is unable to put together. So, no, I am not please with this product and neither is he. He wanted a model, as pictured, because he was in the So. Pacific and saw the Missouri up close. He was greatly disappointed as am I, I feel I was mislead by your ad. Thelma Temple
customer_reviews.author: Thelma L. Temple

product_meta.title: Revell 1: 535 USS Missouri Battleship
product_meta.description:
This is the 1/535 scale USS Missouri the "mighty MO" Us Navy battleship plastic model kit by Revell. Suitable for ages 10 & up. Features: highly detailed plastic pieces molded in light gray two navy seaplanes on movable catapults crane nine elevating guns forward mast and radar screens three movable turrets twenty 40mm Guns authentic us Navy decal markings ten 5" Guns display stand colorful flag sheet historical paper plaque and nameplate waterslide decals illustrated instructions You will receive: one plastic model requirements: assembly

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This battleship was the site of the Japanese surrender in World War II. Features: WWII configuration including scout planes on catapults. Skill Level 2-requires paint and glue (not included).
feature_bullets: Two navy seaplanes on movable catapults
Display stand and historical paper plaque and nameplate

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
